cui_name: Moderate hereditary factor VIII deficiency disease
reasoning: Hemophilia A (factor VIII deficiency) has well-documented prevalence of 1 in 5,000-10,000 males globally (~10-20 per 100k). Moderate severity represents ~25% of hemophilia A cases. Incidence of new diagnoses ~0.3 per 100k per year; prevalence of living cases ~2.5 per 100k. Data from hemophilia treatment registries, confidence moderate due to incomplete global data capture.
